instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2249: What is 820-2249? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.820-2101A: What is 820-2101A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
No sign of water damage, board is clean.

Fan blast high speed as soon as magsafe is plugged in, led is green. Screen is black. No Chime.

When ram is in, no beep, When ram is out, slow ram beep. Put the ram back, no beep.

I measured all the power rail and all the voltages are correct, except

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0.98V instead of marked 1.25V. Is this ok actually?

where should I start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>?

VCORE depends on CPU VID lines configuration; specific to any CPU type.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will have dead GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
Heat GPU for test.
It will be difficult to find good chip for this board anyway.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message: see-ic still has some good ones (must buy them new with white underfill) but they are getting more and more expensive.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
I was told this was a "new replacement board" from somewhere and the board is shiny and ultra clean [not entirely sure if it has been cleaned or what not]. There wasnt any sign of prior repair attempt.

Having said that the GPU could still be the culprit as both of you mentioned.

I am just trying to see what I can do on this. I actually tried to experiment on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2101A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (the 2007 model) where I removed the GPU and the board will still boot and chime with USB activities etc.

Is there a way I can isolate the GPU or disable the GPU in some way [without removing it] and see if the board is still ok otherwise?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
Did the heat test on GPU?
180-200 C degrees for 15-20s; if reacts, then bad GPU for sure.
If no reaction, then you cannot discard GPU yet; but more chances is not the culprit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message: I did. There is no reaction.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
Can still be GPU issue.
Did PRAM reset?
Also disconnect CMOS cell.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
I can turn it on and off with the power button..it even has orange light if i put in the battery.

But it doesnt respond to PRAM reset key sequence.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
All temp sensors connected?
If any not connected, that be the reason for full fans spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
you are right, i didnt have the heatsink on so one of the temp sensors wasnt connected.

I connected the heatsink back and not more high fan spin.

But still no chime and black screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
Even no reaction at heat test, GPU still remains the first suspect.
Just in case, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
I dont have a known good bios but I downloaded one from the internet... still the same....

Do you have a known good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message:
No, I don't have for this model.
I hope you didn't try one from vinafix.

Not much hope to be BIOS, but you need known good dump; to discard BIOS issue.
I saw you had other thread with similar board; read its BIOS and try.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
threads.message: The other board has more vram than this one. Would it works?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2249</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A high speed fan. Black Screen. No Chime
